description: BIOS stands for "Basic Input/Output System" and is a type of firmware used by a computer's microprocessor to boot the computer system when it is turned on. It can also be used to manage the data flow between a computer's operating system and attached devices.

NOTE: To update the BIOS on your computer, download the 208 file from the ASUS website and use the Windows BIOS Flash utility (Winflash), which is available from the same page you downloaded the 208 file, to load the file.
